## WorkerLoader.startWorkerBlob() method

Start worker "via blob" by first loading worker script code with \[\[fetch\]\], creating `Blob` and attempting to start worker from blob url. Waits (using \[\[waitWorkerInitialized\]\]) for successful worker start.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
static startWorkerBlob(scriptUrl: string, timeout: number): Promise<Worker>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  scriptUrl | string | web worker script URL |
|  timeout | number |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;Worker&gt;
